item.title: Freedom enslaves
item.description: Modern art tends to be shit, but this piece that I stumbled upon scratched an itch. Art piece at Parkview hotel The art seems simple. Four humans dressed in prison clothes. They face a cage and are postured towards it. The prisoners are uncaged, free, liberated; yet it seems like they long for the cage. Huh? Why would the prisoners want to be caged? Perhaps they aren’t actually free. If they were free, then they wouldn’t be facing the cage or walking towards it.
